document.title: 2025 South Carolina College and Career Ready Mathematics Standards

1EB722A666874D8896AE2596357E784D.description:
Approximate non-perfect square roots and
cube roots to nearest tenth. Limit to
square roots less than or equal to 400 and
cube roots less than or equal to 1,000.

819D9760AC6C4552A73E1509161010F0.description:
Analyze patterns of perfect squares and
perfect cubes to evaluate square roots
and cube roots. Limit to square roots less
than or equal to 400 and cube roots less
than or equal to 1,000.

EF561038A57745C7A4C1A0BA8683C162.description:
Apply mathematical patterns, properties, and algorithms to the set of rational
numbers to find sums, differences, products, and quotients and to write equivalent
expressions.

391608FF2C8E4450BEADCE1FC75E0864.description:
Determine distance and midpoint of
segments in a coordinate plane to find
areas of triangles and quadrilaterals,
when given coordinates.

60BD66D2EF4A4E6AA76B8F5A55F1D9FB.description:
Use coordinates to prove simple
geometric theorems algebraically.

98C2DA3DDBD24B388373CF014A269959.description:
Determine the exact or approximate solutions of equations and inequalities
using graphs on the coordinate plane.

8CA65CCEE7CE428B9B92991CE9CB35D6.description:
Given a table or a graph, identify the
slope and the y-intercept of a line and
write a linear equation to express that
line.

A125B13E9A1F4781A28DE8C9EEE3750C.description:
Explain why the slope, m, is the same
between any two distinct points on a
linear graph.

704DD9619F964FB0AD7DE824FE41B266.description:
Describe single-variable equations as
having one solution, no solution, or an
infinite number of solutions.

2BFCBE509E8448EFA9765526D89656A6.description:
Write, simplify, and evaluate algebraic expressions; write and solve algebraic
equations and inequalities.

4D403AA39A66474EA5B82A41847DE5C7.description:
Determine the equation of a line passing
through a given point that is parallel or
perpendicular to a given line.

44D7A9D4374D4B559FD63C65CC847EF7.description:
Analyze slopes of lines to determine
whether lines are parallel, perpendicular,
or neither.

4B26863A5BCF46538A6679E703AD3D2E.description:
Apply surface area and volume formulas
for prisms, cylinders, pyramids, cones,
spheres, and/or compositions of figures to
solve problems and justify results.

2122270F9DF4453293AC9A1FB8EE8626.description:
Interpret the structure of expressions, equations, and inequalities to analyze
and make predictions in different contexts.

EF33D7DD57674BCDA6E73B10CF1FEA40.description:
Use multiple representations including
mappings, tables, graphs, verbal
description, and equations (only when
linear) of two functions to compare the
functions and draw conclusions.

5CEFB0FE761B4F678469CBB393BB9F33.description:
Determine if a table, graph, verbal description, or equation represents a
function and describe its characteristics.

C337B6A0E1B844C1AF6C2149FEE8D62A.description:
Analyze and apply the derivations of the
formulas for the circumference of a circle,
area of a circle, and volume of a cylinder,
pyramid, and cone to model real
phenomena and solve mathematical and
real-world situations.

D96D296DC9B7499D91F8BFB7208D5C10.description:
Discover and apply the formulas for the
length of an arc and the area of a sector
in a circle to develop mathematical
models and solve mathematical and real world situations.

84A43D84CA7A47CC8D4F78DD09447D19.description:
Analyze the structure of an equation or inequality to determine an efficient
strategy to find a solution, if one exists, then justify the solution.

046698FCBE6842A3A80E5920AD5DDBCD.description:
Rewrite numerical expressions of
irrational and rational numbers involving
radicals, including addition, subtraction,
multiplication, and division, to recognize
geometric patterns.

D095BEABA3204139B3FAA5E9096E66AD.description:
Represent all points on the number line as irrational and rational numbers in the
real number system.

767AC353AC9544A58A1D35B11D1974FB.description:
Investigate and apply relationships in
circles, inscribed angles, radii, secants,
and chords; among inscribed angles,
central angles, and circumscribed angles;
and between radii and tangents to circles.

492DAD886D2346B4B335E06C32AAD6C6.description:
Use angle and segment relationships in
circles to solve mathematical and realworld situations.

E2B11DE7B1314E0CB31C0E70A5971F4A.description: Investigate and apply relationships among segments and angles in circles.

AB06A6F9745D4F27887161827EFFABA4.description:
Apply trigonometric ratios (sine, cosine,
tangent) and the Pythagorean Theorem
to solve right triangle problems in real-life
situations.

C657F76DBBCD4607907A4085FC83466D.description:
Determine the sine, cosine, and tangent
of an acute angle in a right triangle in the
context of mathematical and real-world
situations.

DDA22F383E564B798E88977A328011C7.description:
Define the trigonometric ratios using the
properties of similar right triangles.

EB25C61F39B548B3A11AD090F9F9C9C5.description:
Discover and apply the constant ratios of
the sides in 30-60-90 and 45-45-90 right
triangles.

3FB452A3B9DB43999513F628A8805AFD.description:
Discover and apply the converse of the
Pythagorean Theorem.

800739FC809049B7969B4BA962E74008.description: Discover and apply relationships in similar right triangles.

D840E8531FD744D6869808948AEBA5E2.description:
Apply the attributes of quadrilaterals,
including diagonals, sides, and angles, to
prove that a given quadrilateral is a
parallelogram in mathematical and real world situations.

11FBEE9860C247B5B9EDEF5900D25E50.description:
Apply the attributes of triangles in
mathematical and real-world situations.

B1D1330572EF42B6908F71B55DCC9557.description:
Justify and apply the attributes of angle
relationships/lines in mathematical and
real-world situations.

286B5960FEB849009FB59AE3DE0DE000.description:
Demonstrate whether a conjecture or theorem is true or false using a variety
of algebraic and geometric explanations.

FF6C055F2EC044AAB2B5A14650C79AD7.description:
Recognize that the criteria for showing
triangles are similar using a similarity
transformation that maps one figure to
the other and justify the two triangles are
similar by applying the Angle-Angle, SideSide-Side, and Side-Angle-Side similarity
conditions.

5740293DE37A49C78782099BD6DDB145.description:
Justify experimentally that a dilation of a
line segment is longer or shorter, given
the ratio.

DC2356F8FEFB4D539096C45C76D9034C.description:
Demonstrate experimentally the
properties of dilations given by a center
and a scale factor.

BA0BE3F7170E48AD857C45B5DA8F0632.description:
Determine that two figures are similar by demonstrating a similarity
transformation or a sequence of similarity transformations that maps one figure onto the
other.

236CD6F91D704E8A9B924BDBC138BF87.description:
Identify congruent angles and congruent
line segments of a preimage and its
image.

563FAE41D52646DFBBC7D7414291A5B7.description:
Recognize the criteria for showing
triangles are congruent using a sequence
of rigid motions that map one triangle to
another and justify that the two triangles
are congruent by applying the Side-SideSide, Side-Angle-Side, Angle-Side-Angle,
Angle-Angle-Side, and Hypotenuse-Leg
congruence conditions.

DC7E76BB8A3848DDA2CCA95795D02612.description:
Demonstrate that triangles and
quadrilaterals are congruent by a
combination of translations, rotations,
and reflections.

632BADD833794B19A0476FF2E245AEA0.description:
Identify types of symmetry of polygons,
including line, point, rotational, and self congruence, and use symmetry to
analyze mathematical situations.

49439F5289B54D64BF94E7006EFF3E44.description:
Determine that two figures are congruent by demonstrating that a rigid
motion or a sequence of rigid motions maps one figure onto the other.

19751E823F8B4FC18BC8220969A668BE.description:
Discover and apply the Exterior Angle
Theorem of triangles to find a missing
angle.

DC54D9524F3D4893B4AE5C3117A5F850.description:
Describe and apply a sequence of
transformations that maps a preimage
onto its image.

2E05B417B5024722A0DFCA7AB289B755.description:
Describe the results of transformations
on a given figure using geometric
terminology from the definitions of the
transformations.

04571BD4B68E4D548A00955CE558BFFB.description:
Apply rigid geometric transformations to figures, describing their attributes
and symmetries.

C65B2589E92F42D7929C9D67A51C337F.description:
Determine if a given set of sides forms a
right triangle.

765BC461855547B683B84AA348AD84A8.description:
Given the Pythagorean Theorem,
determine unknown side lengths in right
triangles in mathematical and real-world
situations.

1BB83937052D4CC79DD3F8382DBC09B8.description:
Find the distance between any two points
in the coordinate plane using the
Pythagorean Theorem.

801225C52B6A4DE7A9FDE99116D726BF.description: Determine the measurements of geometric figures.

A55D4DB5DAB9458C93DC3289B8732F75.description:
Use cross-sections of three-dimensional
figures to model and solve mathematical
and real-world situations.

D80B10ED132A4CEC991B3AEBAD423E61.description:
Identify the shape of a two-dimensional
cross-section of a three-dimensional
figure.

FBE3EF8BAD6F47B1994212F19D0160E4.description:
Apply area and volume formulas of two and three-dimensional figures to solve
real-world situations.

C314AFDF83FB47058D02926E32748142.description:
Compute area and volume of figures by determining how the figure might be
obtained from simpler figures by dissection and recombination.

97417C2B90B843E3AF1E6B950BC79F08.description:
Apply the Multiplication Rule to determine
the probability of independent events and
interpret the answers in context.

5B9372C905F945BE9C1E54D0B80A444A.description:
Apply the Addition Rule to find the
probability of both mutually exclusive and
not mutually exclusive events and
interpret the answers in context.

0927C80CD720485E830A4021A4FBBC5D.description:
Describe categories of events as subsets
of a sample space using unions,
intersections, or complements of other
events.

58B76ED8D6FF497693CFC2F49B179E9B.description:
Solve problems involving the probability of compound events in real-world
situations.

68D45A4D8886489D9CE781C360611B09.description:
Calculate and interpret the probability of
compound independent and dependent
events.

E7716A3CF0FD430F94206D5DD10F00AE.description:
Determine the sample space for a
compound event.

11DED12301784F60A20CFD44F345A5D7.description: Analyze and interpret models for two quantitative variables.

D31994BD5C66460089B7C0FCCA900B78.description:
For two data sets (numerical or
graphical), compare and interpret the
centers, spreads, and overlap of data to
draw inferences about data in
mathematical and real-world situations.
Limit displays to double line graphs, backto-back stem-and-leaf plots, and double
box plots.

9EC09412E0D0473DBDDEE9CECE0A7C1D.description:
Describe how adding and deleting data
throughout the data set can affect the
mean, median, mode, and distribution of
the data set.

633AEB02B6904623AB8A985EBF8D6836.description:
Draw inferences about data sets from two
populations using the shape of the
distribution, measures of center, and
measures of variability. Limit measures to
mean, median, mode, range, mean
absolute deviation, and interquartile
range.

C470A5AEF62E461B9481AFB2E63D3110.description:
Create and analyze scatter plots to
represent numerical data sets in
mathematical and real-world situations.

16FD85E38EE148399F22235F2D1952A0.description: Analyze data sets to identify their statistical elements.

D9E15C8C565F466D8728B703AF591634.description:
Conduct an investigation for a statistical
question, interpret statistical significance
in the context of a situation, and answer
investigative questions appropriately.

461825E09DFF4AA9A3539870A1126084.description:
Use two representative points from the
data to find an approximate line of fit and
compare it to the line of best fit.

4171AA5EA8FC434C80188D3CAB634048.description:
Represent data for two quantitative
variables on a scatter plot and describe
how the variables are related.

DDC15BA6B8EF4D37813273DA05492178.description:
Summarize, represent, and interpret data on two categorical and quantitative
variables.

BEFBE3EAE3A64C82B55453193431D8EC.description:
Identify
and apply regularity
in repeated
reasoning to make
generalizations.

7439A88D7C7B4C7D92AED126A1F60872.description:
Use
critical thinking skills
to reason both
abstractly and
quantitatively.

CAFEFB3D381B43EC964468A7CF4CBC82.description:
Demonstrate a deep
and flexible
conceptual
understanding of
mathematical ideas,
operations, and
relationships while
making real-world
connections.

5A77B9A2D3764928A81F55A3AE01B8DC.description:
Explain
ideas using precise
and contextually
appropriate
mathematical
language, tools, and
models.

0E5547F38AA14032A6F9A750BAC197DD.description:
Make
sense of problems
and persevere in
solving them
strategically.
